ovdesc.p: The user may define the set of rules governing the specific product category of the MG. Within a category, rules may be defined for each currency. These rules are validated at the time of initial input of the deal only.
This table could be used to default the interest rate (or key plus spread) charges and commissions, tolerances on the initial repayment amount and initial interest on to the MG deal.

The table can also be used to control the term and drawdown amount to pre-defined ranges for a specific product category and currency. Should the user input a MG for a term or drawdown amount exceeding the tolerance specified in this table, appropriate overrides are generated at the deal.
If the default values for the respective category are modified at the deal, appropriate overrides are generated.

The downward tolerance for the initial interest that is to be defaulted to the MG deal. The initial 'applicable rate' at the time of striking the deal is stored in the MG record. For fixed rate contract it is the rate input and for floating rate contracts it is the rate in the respective key plus spread at the time of striking the deal. Any downward rate movement during the life of the MG will be restricted to this percentage on the initial interest so derived. For more details refer help on MIN.INT.TOL in the MG application.
Standard T24 percentage format. Negative values not allowed. Value input cannot exceed 100.
Optional Input. Either MAX.INT.TOL or MIN.INT.TOL alone can be defined if so required.
Maximum term for which the MG contracts can be input for the respective category and currency. Term can be defined either in number of days or months or years in the following manner
XXX - where X is a positive number - upto 999 days
XXM - expressed in number of months - upto 99M
XXY - expressed in number of years - upto 50 Y
The MAXIMUM.TERM and MINIMUM.TERM should be of compatible types. That is, both values should be given in the same units of either days or months or years.
If the underlying MG were input for a term exceeding this value an override would be generated.
MAXIMUM.TERM cannot be less than MINIMUM.TERM
Optional Input. Either MAXIMUM.TERM or MINIMUM.TERM alone can also be defined, if so required.

This field indicates the method which will be followed for the generation of schedules and the action which will be taken if the derived date is a non working day.
The following provides an explanation of the various input values for this field:
If the derived day is a non working day the system response will be:
FWD= forward The system will go forward to the next working day.
BWD = backward The system will go backward to the last working day.
FSM= fwd same month The system will go forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month the system will go backward to the last working day.
CAL = Calendar The system will use the same date irrespective of whether dates cycled are working days or not.
permitted values - FWD, BWD,FSM,CAL
